sentence.Network_en: Both doctor and Don smiled at this witticism.
sentence.Network_cn: 大夫本人和老头子都对这样的打趣发笑了.

sentence.Network_en: He tries to lighten his lectures with an occasional witticism.
sentence.Network_cn: 他有时想用俏皮话使课堂活跃.

sentence.Network_en: His witticism was as sharp as a marble.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的打趣话十分枯燥无味.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 以w开头的英语英文单词 ... witless 无智慧 witticism 名言,妙语 wittily 机智地；幽默地.
《Friends》词... ... escape n. 逃, 逃亡, 溢出设备, 出口, 逃跑, [植]野生 witticism n. 妙语, 俏皮话 hissing n. 发嘶嘶声, 蔑视.
以w开头的英语英文单词 ... witless 无智慧 witticism 名言,妙语 wittily 机智地；幽默地.
问两道... ... Facetious a. 爱开玩笑的，轻率地，滑稽的，好笑的 Witticism n. 妙语，俏皮话 Unambiguous a. 不含糊的，清楚的，明确 …

list.abs: Henry kissinger' s old witticism about europe' s having no phone number is more relevant than ever .基辛格对欧洲没有电话号码的老笑话现在看来显得比以往更有意义。
编辑主任 managing editor标题妙语 headline witticism常驻记者 resident correspondent
a speech that was full of witticisms .充满诙谐语句的演说。
we do appreciate our own witticisms .我们非常欣赏自己的小聪明。

derivation.yuyuan_name: 1677: coined by Dryden from witty, on the pattern of criticism

entry.def: A witticism is a witty remark or joke.

means.word_mean: 1. a message whose ingenuity or verbal skill or incongruity has the power to evoke laughter

auth_sentence.content: "I'm on a State Department tour," he added, thereby ruining the purity of his witticism.
auth_sentence.res_content: "I'm on a State Department tour," he added, thereby ruining the purity of his witticism.
